unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Getting a Boost, Finally!**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies getting a boost, finally!

unnormalised: Good news, folks! Remember how everyone in your mohalla was buzzing about solar rooftops a while back? Well, the government's finally giving those subsidies a serious boost. Sources say the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is planning to streamline the application process and potentially increase the subsidy amount by up to 15% for households in states like Rajasthan, Gujarat and Maharashtra.
normalised: good news, folks! remember how everyone in your mohalla was buzzing about solar rooftops a while back? well, the government's finally giving those subsidies a serious boost. sources say the ministry of new and renewable energy is planning to streamline the application process and potentially increase the subsidy amount by up to fifteen percent for households in states like Rajasthan, Gujarat and Maharashtra.

unnormalised: Think of it – less bijli bill drama! "Lag Jaa Gale" to those pesky discoms!
normalised: think of it – less bijli bill drama! "lag jaa gale" to those pesky discoms!

unnormalised: The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) is expected to play a key role in disbursing these enhanced subsidies, making it easier for middle-class families in places like Chembur and Jaipur to afford solar panels. We're talking potentially saving thousands of Rs. annually and contributing to a greener India. Specific details on the updated scheme, including eligible rooftop capacity (likely still capped around 10 kW), are expected within the next few weeks. So, keep your eyes peeled and get ready to go solar! More news to follow, Jigar Jaan!
normalised: the I R E D A is expected to play a key role in disbursing these enhanced subsidies, making it easier for middle-class families in places like Chembur and Jaipur to afford solar panels. we're talking potentially saving thousands of rupees annually and contributing to a greener India. specific details on the updated scheme, including eligible rooftop capacity (likely still capped around ten kilowatt), are expected within the next few weeks. so, keep your eyes peeled and get ready to go solar! more news to follow, Jigar Jaan!
